conclusion: To determine the force F exerted by the rope on the ball, analyze the forces acting on the ball in equilibrium.
The ball is set on a vertically fixed smooth ring with a smooth hole at the highest point of the ring.
The lower end of a light rope is tied with the ball, and the upper end is pulled through the hole.
At the beginning, the angle between the rope and the vertical direction is θ, and the ball is in a static state.
Identify the forces: gravitational force mg acting downward, tension T in the rope, and normal force N from the ring.
Resolve the tension into components: vertical component T cos θ balances gravitational force, horizontal component T sin θ is balanced by normal force.
Set up the equilibrium equations: T cos θ = mg and T sin θ = N.
Solve for the tension T: T = mg / cos θ.
Determine the force F: F = T = mg / cos θ.
The force F exerted by the rope on the ball is mg / cos θ.
